result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed: State's Motion in Limine.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Violation Report 09-16-2022
Received and Filed:  State's Notice of Intent to Use DNA Evidence at Trial

Defendant Jhony J Marchena appeared by video.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court for Jhony J Marchena.  Attorney Grace M. Gall in court for State of Wisconsin.Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defense requests a final pretrial and jury trial date.  Court ordered all substantive motions to be filed by 10-06-2022 and all responses to be filed by 11-03-2022 or they will be deemed waived. Case adjourned, Branch 40.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial - 6 person scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Filed: Original Transcript of PRELIMINARY HEARING ( 12 pages) commencing 06-16-2022 by SANDRA M. KANDZIORA.

Defendant Jhony J Marchena in court with Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer D. Sutyak. Court took judicial notice of 16JV342. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Attorney Stephen Sargent
Received and Filed: Pretrial Supervision Report 06-16-2022
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Jhony J Marchena in court with attorney Colleen A Taylor.  Defendant Jhony J Marchena in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jhony J Marchena appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.   Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 2. State requests to be heard on bail. This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
